definitions.definition: A square cap , originally with four ridges across the top, surmounted by a tuft, worn by Roman Catholic clergy (and by some in the Anglican Church ). A three-sided biretta is worn by Roman Catholic clergy for liturgical celebrations.

main_definition: A square cap , originally with four ridges across the top, surmounted by a tuft, worn by Roman Catholic clergy (and by some in the Anglican Church ). A three-sided biretta is worn by Roman Catholic clergy for liturgical celebrations.
